law.catch_line: A meeting of the board of directors may be held in closed session only for the following purposes:...

text.section:
If a meeting is held in closed session under subsection (a) of this section:
An action may not be taken and a matter may not be discussed if it is not permitted by subsection (a) of this section; and
A statement of the time, place, and purpose of any closed meeting, the record of the vote of each board member by which any meeting was closed, and the authority under this section for closing any meeting shall be included in the minutes of the next meeting of the board of directors.
